org.gbif.occurrencestore.persistence.keygen

Class AbstractHBaseKeyPersistenceService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gbif.occurrencestore.persistence.keygen.AbstractHBaseKeyPersistenceService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    KeyPersistenceService<Integer>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HBaseLockingKeyService, ZkLockingKeyService

    public abstract class AbstractHBaseKeyPersistenceService
extends Object
implements KeyPersistenceService<Integer>
    An abstract implementation of KeyPersistenceService that handles the finding and deleting of keys in HBase, but leaves the generation of keys to sub-classes.

    • Method Detail

      • generateKey

        public abstract KeyLookupResult generateKey(Set<String> uniqueStrings,
                          String scope)
        Description copied from interface: KeyPersistenceService
        Generates a new key for the given unique strings and their scope. If an existing key is found for these strings that is returned instead. The KeyLookupResult will indicate whether the key was generated or not.
        Specified by:
        generateKey in interface KeyPersistenceService<Integer>
        Parameters:
        uniqueStrings - strings unique within the scope
        scope - a scope for the strings' uniqueness (e.g. a dataset key/name)
        Returns:
        the result of the lookup which will contain the key and whether it was found or generated

      • findKey

        public KeyLookupResult findKey(Set<String> uniqueStrings,
                      String scope)
        Description copied from interface: KeyPersistenceService
        Given the strings that are unique within the given scope, find the key for the single record that matches all of the given strings.
        Specified by:
        findKey in interface KeyPersistenceService<Integer>
        Parameters:
        uniqueStrings - strings unique within the scope
        scope - a scope for the strings' uniqueness (e.g. a dataset key/name)
        Returns:
        the result of the lookup - the key within the KeyLookupResult or null if it is not found

      • findKeysByScope

        public Set<Integer> findKeysByScope(String scope)
        Description copied from interface: KeyPersistenceService
        Find the keys for all records within the given scope (e.g. all occurrence keys for a dataset).
        Specified by:
        findKeysByScope in interface KeyPersistenceService<Integer>
        Parameters:
        scope - a scope for the strings' uniqueness (e.g. a dataset key/name)
        Returns:
        the result of the lookup - a List with 0 or more keys of type T

      • deleteKey

        public void deleteKey(Integer occurrenceKey,
             @Nullable
             String datasetKey)
        Scans the lookup table for instances of the occurrenceKey and deletes those rows. It attempts to scope the scan for this occurrenceKey within the dataset of the original occurrence, but note that there is no guarantee that the original occurrence corresponding to this occurrenceKey still exists, so in the worst case this method will do a full table scan of the lookup table.
        Specified by:
        deleteKey in interface KeyPersistenceService<Integer>
        Parameters:
        occurrenceKey - the key to delete
        datasetKey - the optional "scope" for the lookup (without it this method is very slow)

      • deleteKeyByUniques

        public void deleteKeyByUniques(Set<String> uniqueStrings,
                      String scope)
        Description copied from interface: KeyPersistenceService
        Delete the entries in the secondary index corresponding to the passed in uniqueStrings and scope (e.g. delete occurrence lookup by triplet and dataset).
        Specified by:
        deleteKeyByUniques in interface KeyPersistenceService<Integer>
        Parameters:
        uniqueStrings - strings unique within the scope
        scope - a scope for the strings' uniqueness (e.g. a dataset key/name)

      • failWithConflictingLookup

        protected void failWithConflictingLookup(Map<String,Integer> conflictingKeys)
